alert.note: Alert for Martin; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Martin and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walton, Stuart, Jupiter Island, Port Salerno, Jensen Beach, Hobe Sound, Sewall`s Point, Witham Field, North River Shores, Nettles Island, Hobe Sound Beach, Indian River Estates, Ocean Breeze Park, Rio, Waveland, Hobe Sound Wildlife Refuge and Hutchinson Island South. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
